basics.name: Daniil Cherniavskii
basics.label: PhD Student
basics.summary: A PhD student at the University of Amsterdam, advised by Assoc. Prof. Efstratios Gavves and Andrii Zadaianchuk.

work.name: University of Amsterdam
work.summary: Reasoning, planning and code generation with applications to embodied agents.

work.name: Artificial Intelligence Research Institute
work.summary: Topological Deep Learning and its applications to Natural Language Processing.
highlights: Developed a representation learning method that captures the topology of the data space.
Investigated properties of Transformer attention mechanism through topological data analysis (e.g. persistent homology).

work.name: Huawei Technologies
work.summary: Adversarial text generation aimed at evading AI classifiers.
highlights: Developed a topological loss aimed at generating adversarial examples for text classifiers.

work.name: DeepPavlov.ai
highlights: Participated in Amazon Alexa Prize SocialBot Challenge and created a module of flexible large-scale intent classification system.
During a ``READABLE'' competition, aimed at creating an automatic essay review system for state exams, designed modules for structure extraction and topic modeling.

education.institution: Skolkovo Institute of Science and Technology (Skoltech)
Moscow Institute of Physics and Technology (MIPT)

publications.name: STREAM: Embodied Reasoning through Code Generation
publications.publisher: Multi-modal Foundation Model meets Embodied AI Workshop @ ICML 2024
publications.summary: A modular approach based on code generation to ground LLM-based planners in the environmental context and enable reasoning about past experiences.

publications.name: Intrinsic dimension estimation for robust detection of ai-generated texts
publications.summary: Topological intrinsic dimension of the space of AI-generated texts and natural texts in various languages differ enough to be used as a robust feature for detecting AI-generated texts.

publications.name: Learning topology-preserving data representations
publications.summary: A method for learning topology-preserving data representations that can be used for dimension reduction and visualization.

publications.name: Acceptability Judgements via Examining the Topology of Attention Maps
publications.summary: A special topological discrepancy measure between attention maps of correct and incorrect sentences can be used as a robust feature for binary grammatical acceptability judgments.

publications.name: Artificial Text Detection via Examining the Topology of Attention Maps
publications.summary: A robutst method for detecting AI-generated texts based on the topological features of attention maps.
